description: Dive into "Picture-Perfect Phan Thiet: Capture Coastal Wonders" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Picture-Perfect Phan Thiet: Capture Coastal Wonders

places.generalDescription: Doi Duong Beach is a popular urban strip in Phan Thiet, Binh Thuan province, offering a safe swimming environment and a vibrant atmosphere. It stretches from the Rang Dong residential area to the Bo Ke seafood area and is lined with promenades, street-food vendors, restaurants, and hotels. The beach is part of an emerging destination for beach vacationers with stunning sandy beaches in the surrounding areas.

sources.snippet: Watching the blue ocean in the whispering wind brings a fresh feeling to you. You can also experience beach activities in this beach such as bathing, volleyball and enjoy delicious seafood or watch the sunrise. - Address: No.206 Le Loi Street, Hung Long Ward
sources.shortName: A trip to Phan Thiet

places.name: ƒê·ªìi D∆∞∆°ng Beach

reviews.text:
Loud waves crashing onto the shore and a brisk sea breeze to keep you refreshed.

What more can you ask for?

No surfing unfortunately.

The city park looks abandoned. The benches on the embankment are covered with sand, the plants are dry and some are dead. The tiles on the ground are missing or broken in places. I do not recommend wasting time visiting.

Each morning, I make it a habit to run to the beach, where the tranquil atmosphere never fails to soothe me. The ambiance is undeniably therapeutic, and the sound of the waves is something I cherish. Nevertheless, I believe the City Administration should focus more on maintaining the cleanliness of this beautiful beach.

places.address: 206 L√™ L·ª£i, H∆∞ng Long, Th√†nh ph·ªë Phan Thi·∫øt, B√¨nh Thu·∫≠n 77000, Vietnam

places.generalDescription: Sea Links Golf Country Club is a unique resort complex featuring an 18-hole waterfront golf course, luxurious hotels, apartments, and top-notch restaurants. The golf course is renowned as one of the most challenging in Asia and offers stunning ocean views. The Sea Links City complex provides upscale amenities for a relaxing and peaceful stay. Guests can enjoy spacious swimming pools, well-equipped gyms, children's play areas, and beautiful sunset views.

sources.snippet: Co Thach Tu or Hang Pagoda is a special pagoda of Phan Thiet city which is located on a mountain and head the straight out to sea.
sources.shortName: Experiences in Mui Ne, Phan Thiet, Viet Nam

places.name: Sea Links Golf Country Club

reviews.text: Took a tour here as I am interested in finding a place in Vietnam to golf. The folks here were very accomodating and friendly. Its quite more than I expected from the road with no previous research. The place is quite impressive and the golf course looks to be very challenging. Definitely looking at booking some play time here on future visit.
Had a great time playing the course. Lovely staff and caddies. Good course, condition was very acceptable with quick greens. Golf, lunch, beers was $100. Definitely play again

Golf course good. Nice view good Green condition. Trained caddies. Kindness welcome Reception. General everything good but one thing locker room very very old style. Poor shower rooms sometimes no hot water and very weak poor hairdryer.

places.generalDescription: ƒê·ªìi C√°t ƒê·ªè, also known as the Red Sand Dunes, is a striking dune system located near the sea in Mui Ne and Phan Thiet. These dunes offer a unique experience with activities such as sand sledding and breathtaking views of the sunset. Situated just a few kilometers from the city center, they are easily accessible on foot or by tour.

sources.snippet: Also called as the yellow, Golden, pink or less white dunes, these Red Dunes are no less beautiful than white sand dunes. This place is very close to the resort area where tourists could reach even by using bike. It is also conveniently combined with a visit to the White sand dunes along with the Red Canyon by tourist agents.
sources.shortName: Places To Visit In Phan Thiet

places.name: Red Sand Dunes

reviews.text: Must go for sunset!!! If you get there around 5pm, it's still empty enough to enjoy it without the herds of tourists that come past 5.30pm.

The white sand dunes are definitely cool to see, and the scenery is quite unique. However, the visit is fairly quick unless you opt for activities like riding an ATV or taking a jeep tour-these are fun but can get pricey. Besides these activities, there isn't much else to do in the area. It's a great experience to try at least once for the views and adventure, but it's not something I'd feel the need to revisit. Worth a visit if you're in the area, though!

The Red Sand Dunes in M≈©i N√© offer a more laid-back, quieter experience compared to the more popular White Sand Dunes. While they don't have the same vast expanse or major attractions, they still provide a peaceful escape and a chance to enjoy the unique desert landscape.

The reddish hue of the sand is striking and makes for great photo opportunities, especially around sunrise and sunset when the light casts beautiful shadows across the dunes. There are some activities available, like sandboarding, though they're less commercialized and not as intense as at the White Sand Dunes. If you're looking for a more relaxed, short stop to explore the dunes or capture a few photos, it's a nice place to visit.

That said, there's not much else to do here beyond walking around and taking in the view, so it's best for those who want a quiet break rather than a full-day adventure. If you're in the area and have some spare time, the Red Sand Dunes are worth a brief visit, but don't expect the same level of excitement or scale as their White counterparts.

places.generalDescription: Phan Thiet Water Tower, a nearly 90-year-old iconic structure in Binh Thuan province, has withstood the test of time and harsh weather. Despite its history of war and extreme climate, the water tower stands proudly in the heart of Phan Thiet city. It holds deep cultural and spiritual significance for the local community, featuring prominently in poetry and music. Situated within Phan Thiet Kids Park, it becomes even more enchanting at night.

sources.shortName: Experiences in Mui Ne, Phan Thiet, Viet Nam

places.name: Phan Thiet Water Tower

reviews.text: Nice tower and a cool looking bridge nearby
Nice historical tower but you can't enter. I've seen this tower a few times from the coffee shop I frequent. It's beautiful and I wish I could go inside. Not much parking around there.

Located in the Phan Thiet Kids Park, Phan Thiet Water Tower is like a highlight of this place, it's more beautiful at night, I think.
After seeing this, you can take a walk along the C√† Ty River with a colorful bridge Le H·ªìng Phong nearby, you also could see Tran Hung Dao bridge as well.
Highly recommend this place. Although it's located in the city center but quite peace. Love it.

places.generalDescription: Van Thuy Tu Temple, located in Duc Thang Ward - Phan Thiet City, is a significant spiritual site for locals and a popular tourist destination. The temple is dedicated to the Nam Hai deity, revered by fishermen as their guardian god at sea. Dating back to 1762, it houses over 100 whale skeletons, including a remarkable 22-meter long one believed to be the largest in Southeast Asia.

sources.snippet: Located in Duc Thang Ward - Phan Thiet City, V·∫°n Th·ªßy T√∫ Palace is not only a spiritual place for locals but also a famous tourist destination in Phan Thiet. The palace worships Nam Hai deity - one of the sea gods revered by fishermen. According to the beliefs of the people in the coastal areas of Central Vietnam in particular and the Vietnamese people in general, the Whale is considered the sea god who often appears to help them whenever they encounter storms, accidents at sea, so fishermen deeply respect the Whale, considering it as a guardian god.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Stunning Photo Spots in Phan Thiet Loved by Teens

sources.snippet: The construction in Phan Thiet Vietnam originated from the custom of worshiping ‚ÄúC√° √îng‚Äù (a kind of big fish) of the ancient Cham people. The work was built in 1762 in the shape of a Chinese letter ‰∏â, which means ‚Äúthree‚Äù in English with 03 main subdivisions: Ca Ong (whale) worshiping area, Ti·ªÅn Hi·ªÅn worshipping area and Vo Ca worshipping area. This place also displays a 22m long whale skeleton which weighs 65 tons.
sources.shortName: A trip to Phan Thiet

sources.snippet: The Van Thuy Tu (V·∫°n Th·ªßy T√∫) temple was established in 1762 in order to honor a legendary whale, which was strongly believed to save fishermen caught in the bad weather at the sea. A local practice arose annually to pay homage to Mr. Whale. The major attraction is the 22-meter long skeleton of the whale which is thought to be the biggest in Southeast Asia.
sources.shortName: Places To Visit In Phan Thiet

sources.snippet: Van Thuy Tu Temple with the majestic architecture is one of the oldest relics in Binh Thuan province. The temple, located on Ngu Ong Street in Duc Thang ward of Phan Thiet City, is the place to worship Nam Hai god - Ca Ong, according to the belief of fishermen in the area.
sources.shortName: Top Attractions in Mui Ne, Phan Thiet Things to Do
Experiences in Mui Ne, Phan Thiet, Viet Nam

places.name: Van Thuy Tu Temple

reviews.text: Traditional temple with fisherman folk  stories of  whales saving humans in stormy sea üåä,

Temple built to worship whales.
Tour guide can give you details on the history, its included with the ticket, but its only in Vietnamese.
Interesting visit. Good exhibit. But recommend visiting the temple and seeing the many bones of whales at the back of temple shrine. Worth a look, only about half hour for visit all up.

places.generalDescription: Duc Thanh School is a historical site in Mui Ne, Vietnam, where former President Ho Chi Minh lived and worked in 1910. The school has preserved classrooms and a boarding house. It was founded in 1907 as part of the Duy Tan movement against French colonial repression. Visitors can see the restored original school with rows of tables and chairs, a blackboard, Nha Ngu, Ngoa Du Sao, and Uncle Ho's star fruit tree.

sources.snippet: Truong Duc Thanh is located at 39 Trung Nhi Street, Phan Thiet City, Binh Thuan Province - an educational institution built by patriotic scholars in the early 1900s. The initial purpose of establishing the school was to respond to the Duy Tan movement in the Central region at that time. Truong Duc Thanh is also where many traces of Uncle Ho's teaching activities are recorded, before he decided to leave to seek ways to save the country.
sources.shortName: 21 Beautiful and Famous Tourist Attractions in Phan Thiet

sources.snippet: This over 100-year-old relic is where teacher Nguyen Tat Thanh (Nguyen Tat Thanh was one of the names of Ho Chi Minh President) used to live and work. The place still retains the three-room architecture with a tiled roof and ancient large wooden trusses. The teaching space remains a blackboard and a wooden table and is surrounded by an airy garden with a well and a lotus lake.
sources.shortName: A trip to Phan Thiet

sources.snippet: Located in the city center, Duc Thanh school is one of the most visited tourist attractions in Phan Thiet. This is a school founded by patriotic scholars in 1907, mainly teaching the children of patriotic revolutionaries. The school is also a place to mark the time when President Ho Chi Minh stopped to teach before entering Saigon.
sources.shortName: 10 beautiful tourist attractions in Phan Thiet, forget the way back, upload beautiful photos

sources.snippet: This school is established by patriotic scholars in 1907 in response to Duy Tan movement in the Central of Vietnam. Duc Thanh school also marked the period of time when President Ho Chi Minh teaches here before going to Saigon. At the present, Duc Thanh School retained almost all intact one-century mementos
sources.siteName: Living + Nomads ‚Äì Travel tips, Guides, News & Information!
sources.shortName: 10 magnificent must-go places when you visit Phan Thiet

sources.snippet: The Duc Thanh School, situated at 39 Trung Nhi, Duc Nghia Ward, Phan Thiet City, was established in 1907, sharing its founding year with Dong Kinh Nghia Thuc School. The name "Duc Thanh" is meant to inspire national consciousness in the youth. The school has evolved into a renowned, progressive institution.
sources.shortName: A must-visit paradise for travelers

sources.snippet: Duc Thanh School is a historic school founded by patriotic scholars in 1907 in response to the Duy Tan movement in Central Vietnam. Duc Thanh School is also the place associated with a part of President Ho Chi Minh's life. The school is still quite well preserved in the tranquil scenery and lush gardens.
sources.shortName: Top Attractions in Mui Ne, Phan Thiet Things to Do

places.name: D·ª•c Thanh School

reviews.text: Impressive tour in order to be close to the traditional Vietnamese architecture as well as an essential part of the local environment in Vietnamese history. Quite worthy visit to this place, and in hope to see more development in the future to make it more attractive touristic attraction.
The area is maintained well and the entrance is free. Nice place to walk and look around.
The most popular of historic places that you must drop by in Phan Thiet. Here, president Nguyen Ai Quoc touched in 1910 to 1911.

places.generalDescription: Mui Ne Beach is a popular destination for travelers looking to relax in hotels or resorts with private beaches and swimming pools. Visitors can explore the natural beauty of the area, including the red and white dunes, tranquil fishing villages, and local markets. The Bay Mui Ne offers beachfront accommodations with easy access to attractions like Long Beach Pearl Museum and Tropical Minigolf. Guests can enjoy amenities such as complimentary Wi-Fi, tour assistance, and on-site dining options.

sources.snippet: Mui Ne is Phan Thiet‚Äôs most prominent coastal resort town, spanning 15 kilometres of golden soft sandy beaches. Great for experiencing both daily life of the locals and enjoying activities on the beach, tourists can find a picturesque view of the traditional fishing village from the northern area, or play some favorite sports such as swimming, kitesurfing, kayaking, and surfing at the southern area of Mui Ne Beach. Thanks to its rock-free waters, Mui Ne Beach is ideal for these types of activities.
sources.shortName: Places to visit in Phan Thiet, the best time to visit Phan Thiet

sources.snippet: Mui Ne Beach features 15km of sandy beaches, gentle waves and luxurious beachfront resorts. The northern end of Mui Ne Beach is home to a traditional fishing village while the southern caters to recreational activities, including swimming, kitesurfing, kayaking, and surfing. The period between November and March is ideal to enjoy these activities since the weather is sunny with strong winds.
sources.shortName: Phan Thiet: Best time to visit and tourist attractions
Phan Thiet Travel Guide - All Things You Need to Know

sources.snippet: Of course, the number one spot on this list is Mui Ne beach. With its gentle waves and sandy shores, it‚Äôs the perfect place to relax and soak up the sun. Not to mention, the views are absolutely breathtaking.
sources.shortName: Mui Ne: The Most Instagrammable Spot in Vietnam

places.name: Mui Ne Beach

reviews.text: Warm sunlight glistens, brushing against each azure waves coarsing the coast.

We are there to celebrate my birthday last nov. 28  we stay at Meraki Oasis Hotel who has this very beautiful infinity pool. The wave is very high and strong during that time so I dont recommend swimming on the beach. So many local seafood restaurant. This place is very accessible from HCMC so if you want to escape the bustle of the city come in this tranquil beach place.

Beach is more or less gone - there are some parts of sand at some resorts and at the western end (Kite surfing school) and at Papa Kite school, where I got my birthday Kite day! (great)
The water is green brownish (5.Dec)
the clouds are grey...

places.generalDescription: H√≤n R∆°m is a picturesque mountain located 28 km from Phan Thiet city, in Long Son hamlet, Mui Ne ward. The area boasts stunning coastal views with clear blue waters and gentle golden sand hills lined with coconut palms. Visitors can enjoy breathtaking sunrises and sunsets, stargazing at night, or even organize a campfire.

sources.snippet: Hon Rom, famous for gorgeous landscapes, is considered one of the most popular tourist attractions in Mui Ne. The island has its name originating from the shape of itself from a distance. In dry season, straw on the island turns yellow at once, making the whole island look like a giant pile of straw (straw in Vietnamese means ‚ÄúRom‚Äù).
sources.shortName: Places to visit in Phan Thiet, the best time to visit Phan Thiet

sources.snippet: Hon Rom is the name of a small mountain still unspoiled, located in Long Son hamlet, Mui Ne ward, Phan Thiet City. Sunrise and sunset here are really the ideal photo frames that make the photos even more ecstatic. In Hon Rom, the cluster of beaches has many areas such as Hon Rom 1, and Hon Rom 2 with shimmering envelopes.
sources.shortName: Top 7 Must-Visit Instagram Check-In Destinations In Phan Thiet

sources.snippet: There are several beaches in Phan Thiet and Mui Ne of which the best are: Doi Duong Beach in Phan Thiet City Center, Phu Hai Beach (between Phan Thiet and Mui Ne Cape) and Mui Ne Beach (Mui Ne Cape). The beaches are mostly flat and the sand is fine.
sources.siteName: Adventure Travel Agents Family Tours Operators Companies Vietnam

The rooms are fine enough, no ice in the fridge. The sea water was not very clear, diner menu was subpar.
As of 30.04.2024: Full of trash. Not worth visiting here.

places.generalDescription: Doi Duong Beach Park is a picturesque coastal destination located in the heart of Phan Thiet city. The beach boasts white sands, gentle hills, and clear blue waters, making it an ideal spot for relaxation and leisurely strolls. Visitors can enjoy the tranquil ambiance with ample shade from large trees and refreshing ocean breezes. While public facilities are available for a small fee, the park offers wide walking paths and convenient parking.

sources.snippet: Situated at the heart of Phan Thiet City, Doi Duong Beach lies within the Ham Tan Coastal District, approximately 2 kilometers northeast of the main Ham Tan District. To reach it, follow Nguyen Tat Thanh Avenue for about 1 kilometer from Phan Thiet City Center. Doi Duong Park now encompasses the entire Doi Duong Beach, creating an attractive park with parking and restroom facilities.
sources.shortName: A must-visit paradise for travelers

places.name: ƒê·ªìi D∆∞∆°ng Park

reviews.text: we went here after brunch, there was a group of young people playing at the beach and a man chilling on a bench. pretty peaceful. idk if they allow picnic but id love to try
A local beach favorite but is lacking modern design. I would really love to see Phan Thiet invest to make this area more modern and walkable for tourists as other seaside parks in Vietnam

So great time in many times. This period is for slow speed waves, low water level. Should choose the beach in front of Binh Thuan College with few local people, not crowded like new Th∆∞∆°ng Ch√°nh beach park and beach next to Ocean Dune resort.

places.generalDescription: Mui Ne Fishing Village is a serene coastal stretch that spans about 1km, offering a peaceful escape with calm waves and gentle breezes year-round. In the early mornings, visitors can witness the lively trading scene as fishermen return from their night fishing trips. The village provides an opportunity to experience traditional fishing methods and observe the tranquil daily life of coastal fishermen. Additionally, tourists can indulge in a variety of fresh seafood such as squid, fish, shrimp, crabs, and snails at affordable prices.

sources.snippet: Mui Ne Fishing Village stretches along a 1km coastline, particularly known for its calm waves and gentle breeze throughout the year, making it an ideal refuge for boats. If you visit here in the early morning, you'll have the chance to witness the bustling trading scene as fishermen return from their night fishing trips. Visiting Mui Ne Fishing Village, besides experiencing the peaceful life and learning about the traditional fishing methods of coastal fishermen, tourists can also choose from a variety of fresh seafood such as squid, fish, shrimp, crabs, snails, etc., to cook at home or have them prepared on-site by locals at very affordable prices compared to buying at the market, and the seafood is also fresh and delicious.
sources.shortName: 21 Beautiful and Famous Tourist Attractions in Phan Thiet

sources.snippet: Set at the northern end of Mui Ne Bay, the Fishing Village offers a splendid view of an expansive coastline lined with swaying palm trees and colourful fishing boats moored on the water. Also, this is a great place to witness local life and enjoy fresh seafood. If you have a thirst for seafood, just feel free to buy fresh crabs, shellfish, etc., from local vendors and take them away or ask them to cook for you at a super budget price compared to buying from the market.
sources.shortName: Places to visit in Phan Thiet, the best time to visit Phan Thiet

sources.snippet: Having the opportunity to visit the coastal city of Phan Thiet, experience dining, and take photos in the fishing village of Mui Ne will be one of the extremely interesting activities that visitors should not ignore. The fishing village is located along Nguyen Dinh Chieu street, including many interesting seafood trading activities. These 5 following coffee shops will make your perfect Hue travel itinerary.
sources.shortName: Top 7 Must-Visit Instagram Check-In Destinations In Phan Thiet

sources.snippet: Mui Ne Fishing Village boasts a splendid view of an expansive coastline lined with swaying palm trees and colorful fishing boats anchored on the water. It is very busy and bustling in the early mornings when the local fishermen sort out their catch of the day such as fresh scallops, stingrays, crabs and groupers. This will be a great chance for you to explore the daily life of locals here.
sources.shortName: Phan Thiet: Best time to visit and tourist attractions

sources.snippet: From the center of Phan Thiet city, visitors only need to move about 23km to reach the fishing village of Mui Ne. This is one of the tourist attractions in Phan Thiet that is free but easily captivates all visitors. Stopping at the fishing village, watching the fishing boats floating on the sea and learning about the lives of the people here will be memorable experiences in your journey.
sources.shortName: 10 beautiful tourist attractions in Phan Thiet, forget the way back, upload beautiful photos

sources.snippet: The peaceful beauty of Mui Ne Fishing Village seen from above. Mui Ne Fishing Village boasts a splendid view of an expansive coastline lined with swaying palm trees and colorful fishing boats anchored on the water. It is very busy and bustling in the early mornings when the local fishermen sort out their catch of the day such as fresh scallops, stingrays, crabs and groupers.
sources.shortName: Phan Thiet Travel Guide - All Things You Need to Know

sources.snippet: Located in Huynh Thuc Khang Street of Phan Thiet, Mui Ne fishing village has a fascinating charm. Mui Ne Fishing Village is about 3km north of Mui Ne Town. Mui Ne Fishing Village has a beautiful view of an expansive coastline lined with coconut trees and colorful fishing boats moored on the water and sea.
sources.shortName: Phan Thiet travel- Where do we go? Top 10 ideal places to explore

sources.snippet: At the entrance to town is a panorama of hundreds of colorful fishing boats mooring on the water. Further along into town, just off the main road, there is a small but colorful market. The village also offers plenty of swaying palm trees, creating a peaceful air for this village.
sources.siteName: Living + Nomads ‚Äì Travel tips, Guides, News & Information!

sources.snippet: Of course, the number one spot on this list is Mui Ne beach. With its gentle waves and sandy shores, it‚Äôs the perfect place to relax and soak up the sun. Not to mention, the views are absolutely breathtaking.
sources.shortName: Mui Ne: The Most Instagrammable Spot in Vietnam

places.name: Mui Ne Fishing Village

reviews.text: M≈©i N√© Fishing Village at sunrise was an incredible experience. We arrived at 5:30 a.m., which is the best time to see the market in full swing. Fishermen were still bringing in their catch, while women sorted, cleaned, and packed the seafood onto motorbikes for distribution. It felt raw and real-a glimpse into daily life here. As the morning went on, the market quieted, and locals arrived to buy fresh seafood from stalls set up right on the sand. A must-visit, especially for photographers! Easily my favorite experience in M≈©i N√©.

A signature "attraction" of Mui Ne. This venue is not set up for tourists but a real local fish  market. The area has plenty of trash strewn everywhere, but don't let it distract from the evolving authentic slice of daily. Ideally, go at sunrise time (533am) and feel the place comes alive. A photographer's heaven indeed. By 645am, the activities would have thin out by then. With waking up early for this gem. No entrance free needed.

It used to be when you climbed down the stairs you'll get cheap and good seafood.

The stall owners who run it now seems to have swapped a lot of fresh seafood with long dead or clearly spoilt seafood, and they did this 2 days in a row when we patronised them.

We thought the first day was a misunderstanding, but after a whole container of spoilt mantis shrimps, a whole plate of hollowed out crabs and a 2nd day of the same, it is clear these people are unrepentant cheaters.

Take your chances elsewhere!

places.address: W7RH+7MV, M≈©i N√©, Th√†nh ph·ªë Phan Thi·∫øt, B√¨nh Thu·∫≠n, Vietnam

places.generalDescription: Po Sah Inu Cham Towers, a 1000-year-old site, were built by the Champa people in the 8th century to worship Hindu deities like Lord Shiva and Agni. The towers offer stunning hilltop views of the valley and sea. Despite their crumbling state, they are recognized as a national architectural and artistic site. Visitors are drawn to its unique and mysterious architecture, consisting of two pointed towers and a third adjoining building.

sources.snippet: Poshanu Cham Tower, also known as Po Sah Inu or Pho Hai Cham Towers, forms a cluster of ancient Champa temple ruins perched on Ba Nai Hill, Phu Hai Ward, approximately 7 kilometers northeast of Phan Thiet City's core. Although not grand in size, this tower embodies the essence of the ancient Cham people's architectural techniques and ornamental arts. Originating 1,200 years ago, the trio of surviving towers (main, medium, and small) stands as a testament to the Cham Kingdom, with the main tower adorned with intricate carvings depicting Linga and Yoni symbols of Shiva, embodying Cham's growth and reproduction.
sources.shortName: A must-visit paradise for travelers

sources.snippet: When traveling to Phan Thiet, there's a place with a unique and fascinating Cham ethnic culture that tourists cannot overlook, and that's the Poshanu Tower. The Poshanu Cham Tower is an architectural masterpiece of the Cham Pa kingdom, with artistic, historical, cultural, and architectural value, making it an increasingly attractive tourist destination in Phan Thiet. Stepping back in time to explore the glorious relics of the Cham Pa era, make sure to visit the Poshanu Cham Tower.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Stunning Photo Spots in Phan Thiet Loved by Teens

sources.snippet: Located on the top of Ong Hoang Hill, about 7 km northeast of Phan Thiet, Poshanu Tower is one of the most important remains of Cham culture since the 8th century. Despite having a small size, the tower still proves its brilliance, attracting many tourists across the world. The towers have Cham‚Äôs authentic red-orange hue, which suit perfectly to the green of nature and Phan Thiet‚Äôs blue sky.
sources.shortName: Places to visit in Phan Thiet, the best time to visit Phan Thiet

sources.snippet: Poshanu Cham Towers is a group of relics left over of the ancient Champa Kingdom. This cluster of towers is located on Ba Na hill, Phu Hai ward and was built by the Cham people at the end of the 8th century to worship Shiva. Although the size is not too large, the Poshanu Cham tower distilled the quintessence of architecture and decorative arts, creating a majestic and mysterious look.
sources.shortName: 10 beautiful tourist attractions in Phan Thiet, forget the way back, upload beautiful photos

sources.snippet: Poshanu Cham Tower is far about 7km from Phan Thiet city is situated on Ong Hoang Hill, Phu Hai district, Phan Thiet. This is the only architectural vestiges of Cham community that still exists in Vietnam. Po Shanu Cham Towers comprise three ancient worship towers dedicated to Hindu deities Lord Shiva, Agni and Nandi ( also named Main Tower, Medium Tower and Small Tower).
sources.shortName: Phan Thiet travel- Where do we go? Top 10 ideal places to explore

sources.snippet: Poshanu Cham Tower is located on Ba Nai Hill in Phu Hai ward, 7 km northeast of Phan Thiet center. Poshanu Cham Tower is a group of relics of the Kingdom of Champa, with a Hoa Lai architecture dedicated to worship Princess PoshaInu. Princess PoshaInu is loved by people as she was the one who taught people how to plant wet rice, weave brocade, and raise animals.
sources.shortName: Top Attractions in Mui Ne, Phan Thiet Things to Do

sources.snippet: This complex was built in the late 8th or early 9th century to worship Shiva of the Cham people. It almost preserves the intact ancient architecture, clearly demonstrating the wisdom and spirit of the ancient Cham people. At the same time, various religious activities take place here such as: Cham dance, sightseeing and festivals.
sources.shortName: A trip to Phan Thiet

sources.snippet: About 7km to the NorthEast of Phan Thiet City, Poshanu Cham Tower is situated on Ba Nai Hill, Phu Hai district of Phan Thiet. The Tower is the remnant of Ancient Champa Kingdom. It features the great architecture and decoration of the ancient Cham.

sources.shortName: 10 magnificent must-go places when you visit Phan Thiet

sources.snippet: Poshanu Cham Tower is a long-standing historical relic located on Ba Na hill, in Phu Hai ward, about 7km northeast of the city center.
sources.shortName: Name the beautiful check-in places in the coastal city of Phan Thiet
Experiences in Mui Ne, Phan Thiet, Viet Nam

places.name: Po Sah Inu Cham Towers

reviews.text: Smaller than M·ªπ S∆°n complex, bigger than Nha Trang Po Nagar but not so well cared for. Buying an entrance ticket for 15.000 VNƒê you get a combo of beautiful path to the hill overlooking the lagune, gift shop run by Cham ethnic minority, Cham Hindu temples (2-3 buildings) dedicated to princess, to Shiva, and then the monument in the memory of the liberation forces attack on a French garrison in 1947, capturing 35 French troops and one machine gun. Further to the cliff there is a small tower standing, the remains of a French house once owned by B·∫£o ƒê·∫°i, the last emperor of Vietnam.

The Po Sah Inu Cham Towers in Mui Ne offer a fascinating glimpse into Vietnam's ancient Cham civilization. Located on a hill, these towers date back to the 9th century and are dedicated to Hindu gods, showcasing the intricate architecture and artistry of the Champa Kingdom. Though smaller and less crowded than other Cham sites, the towers' red brick structure and detailed carvings make it a peaceful and historically rich destination. Visitors can enjoy sweeping views of the surrounding landscape, including Mui Ne's coastline, while exploring the serene grounds. While the site is relatively quiet and not heavily commercialized, it provides a unique opportunity to immerse in Vietnam's cultural heritage. The best time to visit is early morning or late afternoon to avoid the heat and enjoy the site in a more tranquil setting.

Entry ticket per person is 15000 VNƒê

Nice place to see ChƒÉm culture relics. These are significant Hindu temples. But not that Indian Hindu, but an ancient, unique Hindu of ChƒÉm people. Pretty interesting and should be on your list if you are nearby

places.generalDescription: Prince's Castle, situated on Ong Hoang Hill in Phan Thiet, offers stunning views of the coastline and countryside. Originally built in 1911 by Duke De Montpensier, this French estate has now deteriorated to an old tower and military bunkers. Nearby attractions include the Po Shanu Cham Towers and the tomb of poet Han Mac Tu. Visitors interested in history and a short hike will find it worth exploring.

sources.shortName: Experiences in Mui Ne, Phan Thiet, Viet Nam

places.name: Ong Hoang Castle

reviews.text: It's a lord shiva's temple every Indian must visit this place. The style of architecture is same as our 5 Kedar temples inside the temple you will find shivlinga, murti of lord Ganesha and natraja Bhagwan. Om namah shivay

This is a calm place which is not very popular among tourists. Towers look interesting, but it should not be your main goal of visiting Phan Thiet. There is also a small souvenir shop with cute goods on the hill. The entry price is 25k d/person

Same as ‚ÄúCham Towers‚Äù. Not a good place to visit. Practically a ghost town except for the staff ON A WEEKEND. The place is not well maintained and while it was momentarily interesting to see the towers it is really nothing if you have been to other parts of SEA and seen those structures. The fee is silly and idk why they would charge for such an ‚Äúattraction‚Äù it clearly does not go back into the park maintenance.
